info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN STOKES...WESTERN ROCKINGHAM...SOUTHWESTERN HENRY AND SOUTHEASTERN PATRICK COUNTIES AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF MARTINSVILLE THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prestonville, or near Danbury, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... and Walnut Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
